title: It takes 20+s to create a dataset on win10

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
I was complaining in #5317 about a 7+s runtime for a `create` already, but now we have arrived at 20+s -- a 3-fold increase over the last few months. This is using datalad 0.15.0 and the latest official windows version of git-annex (from upstream website) `8.20210804-g1d3f59a9d`.

Here is a trimmed debug log with timing:

```
C:\Users\datalad\tmp>datalad -l debug create some3
2021-09-18 12:30:59,986 [DEBUG] Command line args 1st pass for DataLad 0.15.0+4.gb0f00c2a2. Parsed: Namespace() Unparsed: ['create', 'some3']

# git init is fast
2021-09-18 12:31:00,047 [INFO] Creating a new annex repo at C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3
2021-09-18 12:31:00,049 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-C', 'C:\\Users\\datalad\\tmp\\some3', 'init'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:00,111 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-C', 'C:\\Users\\datalad\\tmp\\some3', 'init'] with status 0

#snipped 200ms of various commands before git annex init 
2021-09-18 12:31:00,307 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'annex', 'init', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:01,907 [INFO] Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
2021-09-18 12:31:01,907 [INFO] Disabling ssh connection caching.
2021-09-18 12:31:01,948 [INFO] Detected a crippled filesystem.
2021-09-18 12:31:01,993 [INFO] Disabling core.symlinks.
2021-09-18 12:31:02,443 [INFO] Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files.
2021-09-18 12:31:04,356 [INFO] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)'
2021-09-18 12:31:06,306 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'annex', 'init', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true'] with status 0

# 6s alone for git annex init

#snipped 150ms git annex checkattr/add-dryrun and git config

# adding .gitattributes takes 2s!
2021-09-18 12:31:06,489 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-c', 'annex.gitaddtoannex=false', 'add', '--verbose', '--', '.gitattributes'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:08,327 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-c', 'annex.gitaddtoannex=false', 'add', '--verbose', '--', '.gitattributes'] with status 0

# snipped 300ms of verious git commands

# second add of <5 tiny text-files: 5s!
2021-09-18 12:31:08,645 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-c', 'annex.largefiles=nothing', 'add', '--verbose', '--', '.gitattributes', '.datalad'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:13,608 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', '-c', 'annex.largefiles=nothing', 'add', '--verbose', '--', '.gitattributes', '.datalad'] with status 0 

# snipped 50ms of various git commands

# now 6s for git-commit
2021-09-18 12:31:13,664 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'commit', '-m', '[DATALAD] new dataset', '--', '.gitattributes', '.datalad'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:19,797 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'commit', '-m', '[DATALAD] new dataset', '--', '.gitattributes', '.datalad'] with status 0

# 2 more seconds for git-annex sync
2021-09-18 12:31:19,900 [DEBUG] Run ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'annex', 'sync', '--no-push', '--no-pull', '--no-commit', '--no-resolvemerge', '--no-content', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true'] (cwd=C:\Users\datalad\tmp\some3)
2021-09-18 12:31:21,801 [DEBUG] Finished ['git', '-c', 'diff.ignoreSubmodules=none', 'annex', 'sync', '--no-push', '--no-pull', '--no-commit', '--no-resolvemerge', '--no-content', '-c', 'annex.dotfiles=true'] with status 0

10ms later the create is done
```

This slowness is a pretty severe usability issue. It looks as if it is either git-annex causing it, or our use of git-annex on windows is wrong.
